string: a102:\t Time of interview: In 24 hours format

a113_title1:\t The enumerator will read out the consent for understanding of respondent and will mention the purpose of the study and time required to complete the interviews (a separate consent sheet will be provided to the enumerators
a113_title3:\t IF VERBAL CONSENT IS NOT GIVEN STOP INTERVIEW AND MOVE TO QUESTION# A119 OF THIS SECTION TO RECORD THE OUTCOME OF THE INTERVIEW
a115:\t Age of Respondent in completed
a116:\t Does your HH Have a child aged 5-10-year?
a117:\t Does any child 5-10 year of aged group of This HH is suffering from any chronic disease?
a118:\t Is any child in your household aged 5 to 10 involved in any other nutritional research / project?
a119:\t Result of Household Questionnaire interview: Discuss any result not completed with team leader.
No household member at home or no competent respondent at home at time of visit
Entire household absent for extended period of time
Dwelling vacant or address not a dwelling
HH Having a child of 5-10-year age group with Chronic Desease
HH having a child of 5-10-year age group which is part of any nutrition study
a202:\t First, please tell me the name of each person who usually lives here, starting with the head of the household. Probe for additional household members.
a203:\t relationship with Head of household)?

a206:\t How old is (name)?Record in completed years.98 DON’T KNOW

a213:\t Mother Line No (Only for U5 Children)
a301:\t What language do you usually speak in your household?
a302:\t What is your family’s religion?
a303:\t Main material of the floor RECORD OBSERVATION
a304:\t Main material of the roof RECORD OBSERVATION
a305:\t Main material of the walls RECORD OBSERVATION
a306:\t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
a306aa:\t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household? Municipal Community Water Connection
a307:\t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
a307aa:\t What is the main source of water used by your household for other purposes such as cooking and hand washing? Municipal Community Water Connection
a308:\t Where is that water source located?
In own yard / plot out of dwelling
a309:\t How long does it take to get to the water source to get water and come back? Number of minutes
a310:\t Who usually goes to this source to collect water for the household? Is this person under age 15? What sex?
a311:\t How does that water in the household taste?
a312:\t Was the water for drinking clear or muddy at the time of collection?
a313:\t Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink?
a314:\t What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink?
a315:\t How many rooms in this house are used for sleeping? Number of rooms
a316:\t Do you own or rent the house that you live in?
a317:\t Is the cooking usually done in the house, in a separate building, or outdoors?
Separate room used as a kitchen
a318:\t What type of fuel does your household Mainly use for cooking?
a319:\t Does your household have? Multiple Response
a320:\t Do you have your own mobile phone sepretelly?
a321:\t Does any member of this household own? Multiple Response
a321f:\t Car or truck or bus
a322:\t What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use? Note for DC: (If not possible to determine, ask permission to observe the facility)
Flush to unknown place/Not sure/DK where
a323:\t Do you share this facility with others who are not members of your household?
a324:\t Do you share this facility only with members of other households that you know, or is the facility open to the use of the general public?
a325:\t How many households in total use this toilet facility, including your own household?
a326:\t Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?
a327:\t How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own?
How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own? Acre
How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own? Kanals

a329:\t How many of the following animals do the household own?
a330:\t Does any member of this household have a bank account?
a331:\t What is total monthly household income of this house?

a333:\t Who provides this support? (select as many as apply)
a401:\t Please show us where you and members of your household most often wash their hands.
a402:\t Observe presence of water at the specific place for hand washing.
a403:\t Record if soap or detergent is present at the specific place for hand washing [Multiple responses]
a404:\t Do you have any soap or detergent in your household for hand washing?
a405:\t If yes, can you please show it to me? [Multiple responses]
a406:\t How often you wash your hands with soap or detergent or ash/mud/sand? [Multiple responses]
b101:\t You or others in your household worried about not having enough food to eat because of a lack of money or other resources?
b102:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b103:\t Still thinking about the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household were unable to eat healthy and nutritious food because of lack of money or other resources?
b104:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b105:\t Was there a time when you or others in your household ate only a few kinds of foods because of lack of money or other resources?
b106:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b107:\t In the past 12 months, did you or any household member have to eat some foods that you really did not want to eat because of a lack of resources to obtain other types of food?
b108:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b109:\t Was there a time when you or others in your household had to skip a meal because there was not enough money or other resources to get food?
b110:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b111:\t Still thinking about the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household ate less than you thought you should because of a lack of money or other resources?
b112:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b113:\t Was there a time when your household ran out of food because of a lack of money or other resources?
b114:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b115:\t Was there a time when you or others in your household were hungry but did not eat because there was not enough money or other resources?
b116:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b117:\t Was there a time when you or others in your household went without eating for a whole day because of a lack of money or other resources?
b118:\t How often did this happen?
Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b201:\t Yesterday, how many meals were eaten by adults?
b202:\t How does this compare to usual for the adults?
b203:\t Yesterday, how many meals were eaten by children
b204:\t How does this compare to usual for the children?
b301_title2:\t How was the food acquired?
b301:\t Foods made from grains (bread, wheat, rice, maize, etc)
b302:\t White roots and tubers and plantains (potato, sweet potato, etc)
b303:\t Legumes, Nuts and Seeds (beans, peas, lentils)
b311:\t Milk and milk products milk, yogurt, cheese, other milk products),
c101:\t Name and line number of the Index Mother:
c101b:\t Name and line number of index child
c102_title_section:\t I’m going to begin by asking some questions about your child’s general health
c102_title:\t In the last 6 months, how often has (child name) had the following?
c109:\t Irritability or bad temper Irritability
c113:\t Would you say (child name) health is …?
c201:\t How often does (child name) clean his/her teeth?
Three to six time a week
c202:\t What does (child name) usually use to clean his/her teeth?
c203:\t Does (child name) frequently use any of the following? [Multiple responses]
c204:\t How would you describe the health of (child name) teeth and gums?
c205:\t Because of the state of (child name) teeth and mouth, have they experienced any of the following problems during the past year?
Avoids smiling and laughing due to teeth
Other children make fun of teeth
c206:\t How often during the past 12 months has (child name) had a toothache or felt discomfort due to his/her teeth
c207:\t How often did your child go to the dentist during the past 12 months?
c208:\t What was the reason for your child’s last dental visit?
Pain with teeth, gums or mouth
Bleeding with teeth, gums or mouth
c209:\t What type of health care professional did you take (child name) to see for his/her teeth and gum care?
c210:\t During past 12 months, was there a time when (child name) needed dental care but could not get it at that time?
c211:\t What were the reasons that you could not get the dental care he/she needed?
Did not want to spend the money
Child is afraid or does not like dentists
Unable to take time off from work
Did not think it was serious/problem would go away
c212:\t What was the reason for your child’s dental visit?
Pain with teeth, gums or mouth
Bleeding with teeth, gums or mouth
c213:\t How often (child name) wash his/her hands with soap or detergent or ash/mud/sand? [Multiple responses]
c301:\t Eat breakfast on days when you are in school
c302:\t Eat breakfast on days when you are NOT in school?

c303:\t How often meals (breakfast, lunch or dinner) did you get that were prepared away from home in places such as restaurants, fast food places, food stands, grocery stores or vending machines? (please do not include meals provided as part of school breakfast or school lunch)
c304_title:\t Where does (child name) usually eat?
c305:\t When (child name) is worried s/he eat more
c306:\t (child name) eats more when s/he is mad
c307:\t When (child name) does something well s/he give him/herself a food treat
c308:\t When (child name) is sad s/he eats more
c309:\t When (child name) is happy s/he eats more
c310:\t When (child name) is bored s/he eats more
c311:\t (child name) eats between meals even when s/he is not hungry
c312:\t Does your (child name) now take vitamins?
c314:\t How many does your (child name) take per week?
c401:\t Have (child name) ever attended school? If no, probe.
c402:\t Why (child name) didn’t attend school? [Multiple responses]
Domestic household chores unpaid (e.g. child care, washing etc.)
Child work for household unpaid (e.g. farming, family business)
Child work for cash or food (e.g. casual work, petty trade, begging etc.)
No girl school/no female teacher available
c403:\t What type of school does (child name) attend?
c404:\t Does (child name) currently attend school ?
c405:\t In which calendar year did (child name) last attend school?
c406:\t In which calendar year did (child name) last attend school?
c407:\t What is the highest class that (child name) has completed? Grade/Class
c408:\t Did (child name) miss school for at least 1 month in the last year?
c409:\t What was the main reason (child name) did not attend school regularly?
Domestic household chores unpaid (e.g. child care, washing etc.)
Child work for household unpaid (e.g. farming, family business)
Child work for cash or food (e.g. casual work, petty trade, begging etc.)
No girl school/no female teacher available
c410:\t What is the main language of instruction at this school?
c411:\t During the school year, on how many days in a week did (child name) walk or ride a bicycle to and from school?
c412:\t During the school year, how long did it usually take for (child name) to get to and from school each day? Add up the time you spend going to and coming home from school.
c413:\t Is there a source of clean water for drinking at school?
c414:\t Are there toilets available at school?
c415:\t Does (child name) work (paid or unpaid)?

d711:\t Other vegetables (Green beans, cauliflower, okra, zucchini, tomato)
d901:\t Child (5-10 years) Name (Dropdown from HH member

24-Hour Recall (on tablet) The recall should follow a standardized 24-hour recall multiple-pass format. The multiple-pass technique aims to reduce cognitive burden and improve reporting accuracy by encouraging respondents to report the foods that they consumed in stages, with increasing detail and opportunity to review and probe for potentially forgotten or misreported items. 1. Please list all the food consumed yesterday 2. Probe for foods that may have been missed (i.e. carbonated beverages, sweets, savory snacks, fruits, vegetables, breads). As well, probe to ask about additions to the food (i.e. salt, sugar, condiments etc.) 3. Collect time and name of eating occasion for each food 4. Using the measurement toolkit, collect detailed description and portion sizes of each food item. 5. Final review of all foods in chronological order, with portion size.
k101:\t Do you think that your (Child Name) height is appropriate for his/her age?
Height is Appropriate for his/her age
k101_title:\t Read aloud to the selected women of household: Now I would like to ask some questions about you, male head of household and your child.
k102:\t Do you think that your (Child Name) weight is appropriate for his/her age?
Weight is Appropriate for his/her age
k103:\t How tall is your husband (the father of Child name) than you?
k104:\t Approximately how much taller/shorter is he? Please record in inches the difference indicated.
